About Tencent
Founded in November, 1998, Tencent is a leading provider of Internet value added services in China. Since its establishment, Tencent has maintained steady growth under its user-oriented operating strategies. On June 16, 2004, Tencent Holdings Limited (SEHK 700) went public on the main board of the Hong Kong Stock Exchange. Tencent is focused on bringing high-quality and engaging internet services and entertainment to its users. In China, Tencent is the largest publisher of online games and we work together with world-renown developers such as Activision, Epic Games, Halfbrick Studios, King, and Riot Games.
About Our Team
Tencent Overseas IT aims to empower its rapid global growth with future-ready, global IT platforms, applications, and services. We are chartered to lead the Overseas IT strategy, architecture, roadmap, and execution. Our top aspirations are to satisfy our internal/external customers and become a world-class global IT team.
We seek a passionate IT Graphic Designer to work closely with our Overseas IT and various business teams. This position will promote OIT products & events by
unlocking the potential of digital graphic technology. Our IT team aims to provide the best DAY 1 experience for new Tencent employees and daily experience for
all users.
Responsibilities
Primary Responsibilities
●   Collaborate with OIT team to promote OIT Hardware/Software, products, events
●   Periodically design newsletter that informs overseas users of our latest events, tips, or      updates relating to our projects, products or services, etc.
●   Liaise with OIT team on all artworks, image format and design queries.
●   Design, improve and maintain the website (iWiki/Confluence).
●   To undertake photography shoots and design brochures for Singapore office events.
●   Work with OIT team to design training materials to provide the best DAY 1 experience for new Tencent employees onboarding experience.
●   Design the template of overseas IT knowledge documents in one place for overseas users' self-help and regional peer support.
●   Align with continuous improvement program focused on business value, process optimization, cost avoidance, cost reductions and IT “Speed to Market.”

Posts.RecruitPostName: TiMi G1 Montreal – Principal Gameplay Animator
Posts.Responsibility:
Award-winning TiMi Studio Group seeks a Principal Gameplay Animator who is eager to create a new AAA multi-platform game for gaming communities around the world.
We are a new team within TiMi who is ambitiously looking to make massive, open world games for gamers to play for years to come. We are passionate about creating new, compelling worlds to play in and explore. Are you someone who is engaged with building new worlds, understands what captivates players, and cares deeply about gaming as a medium? Are you ready to channel your passion and energy into creating expansive open world games for global audiences? Then, come join us in our ambitious endeavor.

Responsibilities

Share a passion to innovate, especially in the design and development of open world games
Work with the team to develop and manage an animation vision and production plan capable of delivering upon the promise of the game
Keep up to date with the bleeding edge of animation trends within video game development and evangelize ideas that will innovate both the player experience and the creative development of the product
Produce, maintain and optimize the Gameplay Animations graphs (NPCs, 3Cs, Combat, …)
Working with Animation Director, Lead Character Artist, and Lead Technical Artist to design, implement, and communicate best practices to the entire art production team
Working with Game Designers and Gameplay Programmers to prototype and build various gameplay systems (3C, Combat, NPC, …)
Support and improve the integration of animation assets into the game engine
Mentoring team members in animation best practices
Proactively identify opportunities and risks to improve the work of the team, the quality of the project, and studio knowledge as a whole
Have a cross-platform mindset up front and ensure that the animation of the game can support an experience that can work seamlessly on different systems and form factors
Ensure that the animation direction of the game starts with a live product foundation, capable of regular updates and malleable to key changes if necessary Canada-Quebec-Remote

Award-winning TiMi Studio Group seeks a Technical Art Director to develop a AAA, open-world game using Unreal’s latest technology. The project will be released on multiple platforms, with an objective to reach a global audience. As a Technical Art Director, your role will be to lead the development of content creation pipelines to achieve our creative vision.

TiMi Montreal is a new studio within TiMi Studio Group, a subsidiary of Tencent Games. We are passionate about creating compelling worlds for players to explore for years to come. Are you someone who loves participating in building new worlds, understands what captivates players, and cares deeply about gaming as a medium? Are you ready to channel your passion and energy into creating expansive open world games for global audiences? Are you passionate about building technology that supports a unique creative vision? • Anticipate technological advancements and stay up to date on market trends to define our best practices + share them with our studios and the industry. Canada-Quebec-Remote
